intro: Chaetogastra cristaensis, commonly known as the Cristaensis velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils near rivers and forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
